title: Chapter 27: Late Night Party
content:
The delivery man stood rooted to the spot, looking at Zhou Ze, who was seated behind the counter.

“Don’t be afraid. There are no cameras in the store, and I don’t have a voice recorder here.” Zhou Ze stretched. “Of course, you definitely won’t believe me when I say that. Tsk, suit yourself.”

“I don’t know what you mean by that.” The delivery man was very calm.

Someone capable of such a deed would certainly be calm.

The police haven’t specifically identified the arsonist yet; that’s his skill, of course, used here as a derogatory term.

“I’m certain you set that fire.” Zhou Ze spread his hands. He was merely stating a fact, a fact that didn’t require any rebuttal.

“You’re drunk,” the delivery man said.

“No, I’m not.”

Zhou Ze smiled.

“Based on *that*, you’re saying I set the fire? You’re better than the police?” The delivery man’s expression was starting to tense up, but he was still restraining himself.

“Hiss… Of course, I’m not better than the police, but I’m not blind. As for me saying I believe you’re the arsonist based on that, I’m sorry, but that’s not it at all. I merely confirmed you were the arsonist first, then deduced that piece of evidence afterward, just to get a taste of being Conan.”

Zhou Ze pointed behind the delivery man.

The delivery man immediately turned his head. He thought the police were standing there, but there was no one, nor any siren sounds.

In this almost deserted mall, and late at night, there wasn’t even a passerby.

“They all came in with you,” Zhou Ze said.

“Who?” The delivery man frowned.

“The six people who died in the cinema, they followed you in. Then I took one look and went, ‘Oh.’ You’re the killer; it’s obvious, isn’t it? Besides that brain-damaged idiot behind me who’s singularly devoted to hating me, you can’t possibly say the other six victims all mistook their killer, can you?”

Zhou Ze slowly stood up, looking at the delivery man in front of him.

“Playing tricks!” The delivery man almost roared. For some reason, he felt the pressure on him growing, and cold sweat started to trickle down his face.

“Don’t be nervous, they can’t harm you.”

Zhou Ze walked out from behind the counter, holding a plastic bag.

The plastic bag contained small boxes of rice and some pickled vegetables.

In Zhou Ze’s vision, six people, both men and women, were seated on plastic stools, two of them elders.

They were all sitting there obediently reading books, very quiet, not noisy at all.

Zhou Ze placed a bowl of rice in front of each person, with pickled vegetables on top, and disposable chopsticks stood upright, stuck directly into the rice.

Afterward, Zhou Ze took out a bottle of baijiu costing less than 10 yuan, poured it into plastic cups from the water dispenser, and placed a cup in front of each person.

“Brothers, I’m not having an easy time either. This bookstore is constantly losing money, so I can only treat you all with this. Don’t blame me for being stingy, alright? You’re dead, but I still have to live. Anyway, your families will also make offerings to you, so a little bit from me won’t hurt, right?”

Zhou Ze bent down, speaking as if he were normally greeting customers.

Hm, as for that brain-damaged idiot in the back, Zhou Ze wasn’t kind-hearted enough to save a portion for him.

“You f*cking insane!” The delivery man couldn’t hold back. “Ha, I really should record this and upload it online, so my followers can all see what you’re like!”

“Do you dare?” Zhou Ze turned sideways. “You talk as if you actually would. You’ve only been livestreaming for a few days, and Wu Wu’s already gone.”

Yes, there were many reasons the police hadn’t found the arsonist yet, but if they had a key suspect to investigate, it would be very difficult for the arsonist to stay hidden.

“I’m leaving. You’re crazy.”

The delivery man’s previous pleasant demeanor changed. He had successfully leveraged his popularity into livestreaming, earning significant income, not just because he was a “hero,” but also due to his own marketing strategies.

He was very down-to-earth, and his original persona was well-established. On this foundation, livestreaming food delivery, which would normally be a very dull and boring activity, could also be watched with great relish.

He knew he was panicking, he was losing control. So, he wanted to leave, to escape this bookstore.

He regretted coming here today, deeply, deeply regretted it.

Zhou Ze didn’t stop him. However, just as the delivery man reached out to push open the bookstore door,

Zhou Ze took out his phone, checked the time, and said:

“It’s midnight.”

“Dong!”

There was no wall clock in the bookstore, but at that moment, the delivery man seemed to hear a bell chime.

He pushed the door forcefully, but it didn’t budge. He became enraged, checked the lock, the door wasn’t locked, and there was nothing obstructing it, yet it wouldn’t open.

The delivery man started kicking the door like a madman, but it still didn’t budge.

What he couldn’t see was,

The six people who had been sitting there reading,

All slowly stood up.

It was the seventh-day return of the spirit night<sup>1</sup>.

Every wrong has its perpetrator, every debt its debtor<sup>2</sup>.

They had come here, following their enemy,

And now,

They were all staring intently at their enemy,

A man who had clearly set fire to and killed them, yet had become a hero.

“I told you not to save me!”

A low growl came from behind Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze coincidentally blew on his fingernails at that moment, then suddenly turned around. The fingernails on his right hand instantly lengthened, a translucent black emitting an unusual glow, and wisps of black aura swirled around his fingertips, bringing a terrifying presence.

Simultaneously, black mist swirled in Zhou Ze’s eyes.

“Hiss, hiss, hiss… Ah, ah, ah, ah, ah!!!!!”

The black-suited man, who had just painstakingly transformed into a vengeful spirit, was directly grabbed by the shoulder by Zhou Ze’s hand. He then began to tremble all over. The black aura from Zhou Ze’s fingertips was like sharp little knives constantly piercing his body, and wisps of green smoke rose upwards from the top of the black-suited man’s head.

“I understand you, but you disgust me.”

Zhou Ze said in a deep voice,

“So, you’d better say goodbye.”

Zhou Ze exerted more force with his fingers.

The black-suited man howled while showing a pleading expression. He hoped Zhou Ze would spare him. He had already become a vengeful spirit; if he “died” again, his soul would be scattered, without even a chance to enter hell.

But Zhou Ze didn’t let go,

His gaze remained icy.

It wasn’t until the black-suited man’s body had completely melted and vaporized,

That he withdrew his hand, seeing faint ashes in his palm.

“Hoo…”

Zhou Ze blew on his palm, then clapped his hands.

Turning around, Zhou Ze sighed.

He wasn’t sure if it was because of his presence that the bookstore’s layout had changed,

Or perhaps,

This was just a coincidence.

The six customers who had previously entered and quietly read books were now all beginning to emit black mist from their bodies, showing a tendency to transform into vengeful spirits for revenge.

Meanwhile, the delivery man was still relentlessly punching and kicking the wall.

Looking up, “Heaven spares no one” might be referring to the scene before them.

These six victims had also been in a panic amid rolling thick smoke and fire, bewildered, ultimately failing to escape and dying tragically within.

“Everyone, give me some face, please don’t rush to become vengeful spirits.”

Zhou Ze walked among the group, raising a hand to signal to the six people.

“Come on, relax a bit. How about a smile for your brother?”

Zhou Ze wanted to ease the atmosphere. Once they transformed into vengeful spirits, they wouldn’t enter reincarnation. After taking revenge and completely losing their obsession, they could only dissipate into the wind.

This was the most tragic outcome.

Zhou Ze felt it wasn’t worth it, truly not worth it.

The arsonist had already caused your deaths, separating you from your loved ones by life and death. Your children lost their father or mother, your parents lost their child,

There’s no need to push yourselves into an even more terrifying abyss because of this killer.

However, Zhou Ze’s words had no effect.

The six people’s faces remained icy, and the black mist on their bodies was growing thicker. Black lines were starting to appear at the corners of their eyes and lips.

They were about to turn into the same appearance as that brain-damaged man in black just before he rushed at him.

“Since you won’t smile for your brother, how about your brother smiles for you?”

Zhou Ze forced an ugly smile.

It was over.

What a disaster.

It couldn’t be salvaged.

Zhou Ze knew it was easy for him to scatter the souls of these vengeful spirits, just like that brain-damaged idiot who had been following him for a week, who had finally finished his cooldown and was about to unleash his ultimate move, only to be slapped to death by him.

But to transcend these ghosts? He really didn’t know how to do it. Moreover, Zhou Ze himself was a ghost, so it wasn’t convenient for him to do such a thing, like asking Zhang Fei to do embroidery.

“The Underworld has a path, the Yellow Springs can be crossed!”

A sharp shout came from outside. Immediately after, the bookstore door was pushed open, and Xu Qinglang entered, holding a small porcelain bowl. The bowl contained grains of rice, and three incense sticks were stuck upright in it.

“Arise!”

The three incense sticks burned quickly.

Simultaneously, the grains of rice in the bowl also changed from translucent white to black, and the black mist on the six people began to fade. Finally, their expressions transformed from their initial icy solemnity to peace and tranquility.

The six people slowly sat down, in front of their bowls and chopsticks.

“Xu Qinglang!” Zhou Ze pointed at Xu Qinglang and exclaimed,

Very excited,

Truly excited,

More excited than seeing Dr. Lin step out of the bath,

Just think about how difficult it had been for him to eat this past week.

How could he not be excited!

As for Xu Qinglang’s recent display, Zhou Ze wasn’t surprised. In truth, everyone had merely seen through it but chosen not to speak of it before.

Xu Qinglang gave Zhou Ze a sidelong glance. In that instant, a myriad of charms appeared, as if the azaleas on the mountains had all bloomed,

But at the same time, he said exasperatedly:

“Are you having a Chinese New Year midnight party here?”

“I didn’t want to,” Zhou Ze said, briefly explaining the situation to Xu Qinglang.

Xu Qinglang nodded, indicating he understood, then cupped his hands and bowed to the six people, saying:

“Everyone, it’s the seventh-day return of the spirit night. You should go back and see your loved ones; they’re probably waiting for you at home. I will give you an explanation for what happened here.”

Hearing this, the six people silently passed through the glass and left.

Zhou Ze’s gaze then fell on the bowl containing the “black rice.”

“How come this stuff has no effect on me?”

Xu Qinglang’s mouth twitched. He strongly suppressed the urge to flare up and fight Zhou Ze for three hundred rounds,

And huffed:

“You’re different.”

He was still angry, still had issues with Zhou Ze, and was still disgruntled, but due to his appearance, temperament, and voice, that phrase, “You’re different,” carried the rich, deep-seated resentment of a cloistered maiden.

Immediately afterward,

Xu Qinglang looked at the delivery man, who was curled up in a corner, having fainted from fear. “How do we deal with him?”

As he spoke, Xu Qinglang made a gesture of cutting clean through.

Zhou Ze shook his head,

And said:

“Let’s still turn him over to the state.”

---
<sup>1</sup> **Seventh-day return of the spirit night (頭七回魂夜):** In some Chinese folk beliefs, the spirit of a deceased person returns to their home on the seventh day after death.
<sup>2</sup> **Every wrong has its perpetrator, every debt its debtor (冤有頭債有主):** An idiom implying that justice will be served, and the person responsible for a wrong or debt will ultimately face consequences.
